pageTitle: The wind in the willows / Kenneth Grahame ; illustrated by David Roberts.
textAfterTable: The wind in the willows / Kenneth Grahame ; illustrated by David Roberts. Authors: Grahame, Kenneth, 1859-1932, author. Call number: jFIC GRA Publication: Somerville, Massachusetts : Candlewick Press, 2013 Publication date: 2013 Subject: Animals -- Juvenile fiction. Country life -- England -- Juvenile fiction. Title: The wind in the willows / Kenneth Grahame ; illustrated by David Roberts. Edition: First U.S. edition. Physical description: 249 pages : illustrations ; 26 cm Notes: Originally published: Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2012. Summary note: 520 "Meek little Mole, willful Ratty, Badger the perennial bachelor, and petulant Toad. Since their first appearance over a hundred years ago in 1908, they've become emblematic archetypes of eccentricity, folly, and friendship. And their misadventures--in gypsy caravans, stolen sports cars, and their beloved Wild Wood--continue to capture readers' imaginations and warm their hearts long after they grow up. Begun as a series of letters from Kenneth Grahame to his son, THE WIND IN THE WILLOWS is a timeless tale of animal cunning and human camaraderie"-- Provided by publisher. Added author: Roberts, David, illustrator. ISBN: 9780763665265 (hardcover) 0763665266 (hardcover) Url for this record:
